message_1: How many different isomers can be obtained from hexane (C6H14)? Provide the structural formula of each isomer.
message_2:
Hexane (C6H14) can have a total of 5 different isomers. Here are the structural formulas of each isomer:

1. n-Hexane (normal hexane):
   CH3-CH2-CH2-CH2-CH2-CH3

2. 2-Methylpentane (isohexane):
   CH3-CH(CH3)-CH2-CH2-CH3

3. 3-Methylpentane:
   CH3-CH2-CH(CH3)-CH2-CH3

4. 2,2-Dimethylbutane:
   CH3-C(CH3)2-CH2-CH3

5. 2,3-Dimethylbutane:
   CH3-CH(CH3)-CH(CH3)-CH3

These are all the possible isomers of hexane.
